title.narrative: International Commission of Jurists (ICJ) / Global Redress and Accountability through the Rule of Law

description.narrative: Around the world impunity for serious human rights violations remains a significant challenge as victimsespecially the most marginalized and disadvantaged remain without effective remedies and reparations(redress). Achieving accountability for violations h as been recognized as a crucial factor in preventingconflict and contributing towards stability and sustainable development in line with SustainableDevelopment Goal 16 (SDG16). Building on the achievements of the previous phases the project willcontinue to apply a victim-centred - and gender-sensitive - approach to address legal policy institutionalsystemic and other obstacles to achieving accountability in six focus countries (Colombia MyanmarNepal Tajikistan Tunisia and Zimbabwe) and at the international level by engaging with accountability mechanisms UN bodies and the International Criminal Court (ICC). This will be achieved by using the ICJ?s unparalleled access and influence nationally regionally and globally including through its network of judges and lawyers (particularly its Commissioners including those from the focus countries).The overall objective is to increase access to justice for victims through entrenchment of the rule of law so that societies realize sustainable peace and inclusiveness prov iding access to justice and redress for all holding perpetrators of human rights violations to account and providing effective accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels. The project will strive to ensure that victims especially the most marginal ized and disadvantaged have access to truth justice and reparations. It will further the objective of eliminating discrimination and achieving equal respect for every person?s human rights with special attention paid to the gender dimensions of combatting impunity and achieving redress. This will be achieved through the empowerment of the most marginalized and disadvantaged groups and their representatives by equipping them with the knowledge confidence and support to demand redress and accountability.The p roject will adopt a dual approach in seeking to bolster and implement existing human rights laws standards and systems while simultaneously developing and promoting new and progressive developments. Applying the human rights based approach the project reco gnizes the need for actionaccompanied by strong advocacy platforms led and owned by victims HRDs and civil society.

Hanke jatkaa edellisten vaiheiden saavutusten pohjalta uhrikeskeisen ja sukupuolisensitiivisen lähestymistavan soveltamista tavoitteena tunnistaa oikeudellisia poliittisia institutionaalisia järjestelmää koskevia ja muita vastuuvelvollisuuden esteitä kuudessa kohdemaassa (Kolumbia Myanmar Nepal Tad?ikistan Tunisia ja Zimbabwe) sekä kansainvälisellä tasolla vaikuttaen YK:n elimissä ja Kansainvälisessä Rikostuomioistuimessa (ICC). Tämä saavutetaan käyttämällä ICJ:n vaikutusvaltaa kansallisest i alueellisesti ja maailmanlaajuisesti esimerkiksi tuomareista ja asianajajista koostuvaa verkostoa (erityisesti sen komissaarit mukaan lukien kohdemaista tulevat). Yleistavoitteena on parantaa uhrien oikeussuojakeinoja vahvistamalla oikeusvaltioperiaatett a jotta yhteiskunnat takaisivat kestävän rauhan ja osallisuuden oikeussuojan ja ihmisoikeusloukkausten tekijöiden vastuullisuuden sekä tarjoaisivat tehokkaita vastuullisia ja osallistavia instituutioita kaikilla tasoilla. Hankkeella pyritään varmis tamaan että uhreilla ja etenkin syrjäytyneimmillä ja heikoimmassa asemassa olevilla on pääsy totuuteen oikeuteen ja hyvityksiin.
